alert.note: Alert for Warren (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 26 at 4:55PM CDT until March 26 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL WARREN AND NORTHWESTERN HINDS COUNTIES... At 454 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Bolton, or 9 miles west of Clinton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. At 421 PM, trees and powerlines were reported down around the Vicksburg area. At 453 PM, golfball size hail was reported near Bolton. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Bolton around 500 PM CDT. Brownsville around 505 PM CDT. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central and west central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
